article_text:
Republicans in Congress are divided about how to respond to President Obama unilateral immigration order, though they seem determined to take a run at defunding the order’s enforcement next year. That won’t be as easy as it sounds given the presidential veto, which means that the lawsuit filed recently by Texas and 24 other Attorneys General may be the best chance to discipline Mr. Obama’s legal abuses.

The White House is offering de facto legal status, work permits and government benefits to millions of undocumented...

twitter.description: Texas and 24 other states have a good case on the immigration order, the Wall Street Journal writes in an editorial.
twitter.title: The States vs. Obama

image.alt: The States vs. Obama on Immigration

The White House is offering de facto legal status, work permits and government benefits to millions of undocumented...
Republicans in Congress are divided about how to respond to President Obama unilateral immigration order, though they seem determined to take a run at defunding the order’s enforcement next year.
That won’t be as easy as it sounds given the presidential veto, which means that the lawsuit filed recently by Texas and 24 other Attorneys General may be the best chance to discipline Mr. Obama’s legal abuses.
